this game together with the tunic made me fall in love with games once again such a refreshing handcrafted pure joy i personally hate soulslikes but deaths door takes only a few core principals of them and turns suffering into sweating i cant be stuck in this game on a single spot for 5 hours but i done want and dont have to and thats great visuals are cute metroidvania aspect keeps hooked in general i cant even remember something i didnt like about the game just wow
a cute game with simple yet satisfying combat and a charming presentation its on the short side but if youre in the mood for a relaxing little avian adventure this is a great place to look
smooth game with good controls i really like the weapons and crow

do you like oldschool topdown zelda do you like challenging combat exploration colorful mysterious places to explore all with very interesting thoughts on different ways people react to the idea of death  this game is all of that its fun its challenging its long enough to feel like an accomplishment but short enough to not feel like a chore to complete plus you are rewarded for exploration around every corner
fun game with a touch of humor i had fun with this one

for casual gamers itll be a challengingbutaccessible entree to soulslites for really hardcore folx itll be a nice quick little diversion   really tight efficient game design with a tight efficient world every single thing has a place truly exceptional art direction and music great writing that balances the macabre and the comedic modestly challenging but voluminous mini puzzles   given the runtime though this might be best bought on sale

super fun game the combat is clean and this game is just really pretty not super difficult but also not boring i cant wait to forget the enemy patterns and story in a few years so i can come back and play it all over again highly recommend

its okay should probably get it on sales i find myself googling a lot of death door where should i got after  while playing this game there should be a better direction especially since its actually a linear game despite the socalled open world back tracking is also hard it seems adding a map should resolve this the enemy gets boring after a while its a copy paste enemy all the way till the end even final boss is just a bunch of same movement jumbled together
this was so fun 100 after 23 hours lots of secrets challenging combat but not too hard puzzles i really enjoyed it and an interesting story too
it has a couple frustrating mechanics but i still an enjoyable experience overall
solid isometric zeldalike  starts slow but ends strong  good story not too long
